contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary}} '''Recruit''' (from the French ''recrue'', from the verb ''recroÃ®tre'' 'to grow again', i.e. replenish the ranks) can refer to: * a recently enlisted member of a military or paramilitary corps, still in training, as in : ** [[Army recruit]] ** [[Seaman recruit]] ;Entertainment * ''[[The Recruit]]'', 2003 film starring Al Pacino * [[Recruits (TV series)|''Recruits'' (TV series)]], a 2009 Australian TV series about the New South Wales Police Force * [[The Recruit (Dad's Army episode)|"The Recruit" (''Dad's Army'' episode)]],1973 British TV episode * ''[[CHERUB: The Recruit]]'', 2004 novel * "Recruits", 1988 Canadian comedy movie similar to ''Police Academy'' ;Ships * {{HMS|Recruit}}, various ships of Britain's Royal Navy * {{USS|Recruit}}, various ships of the U.S. Navy ;Other * [[Recruit (Japanese company)]], an advertisement, publication and human resources company ==See also== *[[Recruitment]] {{disambiguation}}
